name: Pork Carnitas
author: Nette
summary: Many find carnitas a little dry or flavorless.  These have a great, distinctive flavor and are requested by friends and family over and over. Serve with warm, fresh tortillas and salsa.
ingredients: 4 pounds pork shoulder, cut into several large pieces
directions: Heat the vegetable oil in a large Dutch oven over high heat
Season the pork shoulder with salt, then arrange the pork in the Dutch oven
Cook until browned on all sides, about 10 minutes
Add the onion, garlic, lime juice, chili powder, oregano, and cumin
Pour in the chicken broth, and bring to a boil
Reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and continue to simmer until pork is very tender, about 2 1/2 hours
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
Transfer the pork shoulder to a large baking sheet, reserving the cooking liquid
Drizzle with a small amount of the reserved cooking liquid and lightly season with salt
Bake the pork in the preheated oven until browned, about 30 minutes
Drizzle more of the cooking liquid on the meat every 10 minutes, and use two forks to shred the meat as it browns
